thread.title: Chinese phonemaker Huawei pushes hard at Apple
thread.title_full: Chinese phonemaker Huawei pushes hard at Apple

title: Chinese phonemaker Huawei pushes hard at Apple
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Chinese phonemaker Huawei pushes hard at Apple Samsung’s Galaxy S6 was displayed at the IFA conference alongside medical and wearable technology, fridges and “smart ovens” Sean Gallup/Getty Images Google+ 1 of 1 Samsung’s Galaxy S6 was displayed at the IFA conference alongside medical and wearable technology, fridges and “smart ovens” Sean Gallup/Getty Images Nic Fildes Technology & Communications Editor Published at 12:01AM, September 5 2015 
A low-profile Chinese telecoms equipment group appears to have stolen a march on Apple by unveiling a smartphone that responds to different levels of pressure applied by the user’s thumbs or fingers. 
Huawei used a conference in Berlin this week to launch the Mate S, which is built around the concept of “Force Touch”, meaning that different functions and apps are triggered depending on how hard the user presses on the phone’s screen. 
The company, based in Shenzen, thus has stolen a march on Apple, the darling of Wall Street and Silicon Valley, which is set to introduce Force Touch Subscribe now 
To see the full article you need to subscribe Subscribe
